stories.text:
live-paint (https://paint.liveviews.cc/) is a demonstration of ts-liveview v2-rc3. The server converts JSX expression into plain HTML response. The UI is then updated via websocket.

As opposite to React.js. The DOM updates are fired from server, and instructed with query selector (no virtual DOM). Hence, the amount of javascript downloaded and executed by client are minimal (or even optional for static web pages).
stories.title: Show HN: Live-paint (powered by ts-liveview)

stories.text:
To improve web search, we need to break down problems and make algorithms, code, and data accessible.

For starters, we need a communal dataset of 50-100 million urls/data/metadata that's "good" (for any value of good) to help people experiment with web search tech.

We need more Kaggle competitions to explore better summarization, reader mode text extraction, boilerplate removal, etc. What other competitions would help web search?

How can we foster a sustainable community and projects to create a bazaar of web search engines?
stories.title: Ask HN: Bazaar of Web Search Engines?
